intro: Cacalia laciniata, commonly known as the cutleaf bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant features finely divided, lobed leaves that give it its common name, and it typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils. Cacalia laciniata is often found in alpine and subalpine environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant in botanical gardens and specialty horticulture.
